metadata.title: CVE-2015-7814 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Race condition in the relinquish_memory function in arch/arm/domain.c inXen 4.6.x and earlier allows local domains with partial management controlto cause a denial of service (host crash) via vectors involving thedestruction of a domain and using XENMEM_decrease_reservation to reduce thememory of the domain.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-7814` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libxen-4.4 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
libxen-ocaml - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
libxenstore3.0 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
xen-hypervisor-4.1-amd64 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
xen-hypervisor-4.3-amd64 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
xen-hypervisor-4.3-armhf - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
xen-hypervisor-4.4-amd64 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
xen-hypervisor-4.4-arm64 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
xen-hypervisor-4.4-armhf - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
xen-system-amd64 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
xen-system-arm64 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
xen-system-armhf - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
